SEARCH

Package main.java.progOO2.p04

package main.java.progOO2.p04

Programming Object Oriented II: Room

This package introduces a key object-oriented programming concept: the use of constructors with parameters to initialize object attributes upon creation.

Key learning goals:

  • Class definition: The Room class defines a simple real-world entity with properties like code and seats.
  • Parameterized constructor: Students learn to initialize object fields using constructor parameters, reinforcing the connection between class structure and real data.
  • Encapsulation (progressive): Fields are declared as private, introducing controlled access and preparation for methods and accessors.

This package builds on previous exercises involving attributes and lays the foundation for object instantiation and constructor chaining.

Note: The included Room class is part of a guided exercise and may be expanded with methods or accessors in later steps.
